website_summaries.verdict: The best pool pump on the market in the 3 horsepower range, its energy efficiency alone is worth a look.
pros: Allows for customized speed settings and scheduling
Runs quietly, with noticeable energy savings over older pumps
cons: Can build up air bubbles if operated at low speed for a long time
Scheduling run times can be difficult even after reading guide
Strainer basket is a bit small

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this pump and had it installed professionally 2 months ago and its already crapped out. My pool guy has no idea whats wrong with it and we are not getting much help through the manufacturer (big surprise). The error code on the screen is a common problem that i see from the chats out there. you would think that when you spend $1000 on a pump that it would run a little longer than 2 months. my last one lasted 10 years before i had issues and had to replace! i would give this zero stars if i could. i wouldn't recommend this pump to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: clarke01

customer_reviews.title: Very easy installation but you must pay a pool company 400 ...
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this pump from Amazon and install it you only have a 60 day warranty. You have to buy and and have a professional pool company install this pump to have a 3yr warranty. I installed this pump and it lasted 11 months. Pentair does not stand by their pumps. Very easy installation but you must pay a pool company 400 dollars to have a warranty. I will never order this pump again from Aamzon.
customer_reviews.author: AIwonder

customer_reviews.title: 30 days and needs to be repaired
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump, had it installed and 30 days later it is leaking. The pool guy says it is a pump seal. 30 days and a bad pump seal? I filled out the warranty info within the 60 required days. Since it was purchased through Amazon/prime I am not sure that the required information boxes for the seller are correct. It was installed two weeks after purchase so I cannot return it. UNHAPPY Customer I don't want a repaired pump..... I bought a NEW pump.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy pentair inteliflo pool pump
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT AFTER APPROX 2 YEARS PUMP STOPPED DUE TO MOISTURE IN ELECTRONIC TOUCH SCREEN. MFG IS COVERING UNDER WTY AND SHOULD BE FIXED HOWEVER BIG HASSLE! APPARENTLY THIS POOL PUMP SHOULD NOT BE EXPOSED TO THE ELEMENTS???????? PENTAIR SAID WTY WAS REDUCED FROM 3YR TO 2YEAR IN 2016. WONDER WHY!!! Would give no star if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Decker

customer_reviews.title: Pentair does not honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item through Amazon and the pump housing cracked after two seasons. This pump is still under manufacturers warranty and pentair simply refused to honor it. This install was a new pump, filter, chlorinator and valves which were all Pentair products. If they refuse to honor the warranty on this pump, the warranty on the remaining equipment is equally worthless.
customer_reviews.author: M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: I bought this unit for almost $900. In 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for almost $900. In 4 months since install, it built up condensation under the LCD panel window, and shortly failed. I checked the seals - which are all intact. So, no IDEA how the moisture/liquid got into the housing and shorted the motor. I'm hoping the seller will contact me to take care of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented rebate, must pay professional installer for full warrenty, difficult to reprogram
customer_reviews.text: Pentair misrepresented rebate program. Poor customer service from manufacturer. One year later the pump is still working. Very difficult preprogram speeds and timer for different seasons. Not a big issue but the pump and motor paint fade differently over time... Now they are completely different shades of beige. I'm still upset over their refusal to honor the rebate for units purchased on line.
customer_reviews.author: Broil King Baron owner.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 5 months, but it appears it does not last. Although I am an electrician, I am not a authorized Pentair serviceman therefore Pentair will not warranty the product because I installed it myself. I have all Pentair products on my pool and prior to this I thought Pentair was a great product, but looking at other options after this. It is giving me a overcurrent alarm and based on some initial testing it appears the motor is bad and has an internal short. At the cost of this product I would expect a better warranty.
customer_reviews.author: R W.

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 year old and leaking already!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump last August (2017) and one of the gaskets/connections is already leaking. According to my pool guy (who did not install this product) this is a manufacturer issue, not a installation issue. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: since installing it my bill is the same as when I ran 2 Hayward super pumps, one for spa and the other for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone can show me how they get huge savings using this pump, since installing it my bill is the same as when I ran 2 Hayward super pumps, one for spa and the other for pool. the only savings I see is when I shut the pump off completely!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Doing the bull dance, feeling the Flo...
customer_reviews.text: This product is miserable to program but once set up works well. The manual is terrible. I had to search online forums to learn how to properly program it as even my pool professional was not able to get it right the first 2 tries. BEWARE, Pentair only provides the full warranty if the device is installed by a licensed professional and the documentation is scanned and uploaded to their website and then confirmed. Otherwise you only get like 30 or 90 days warranty.
customer_reviews.author: UCrazyKid

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this pump 10/10/18 and it stopped working 5 days ago. Spoke with amazon customer service and they referred me to pentair. After many unsuccessful attempts to contact Pentair, I was finally able to speak someone today. They will not stand behind their products and now I’m stuck with over $1000.00 in a piece of junk that won’t work. Buyer beware. Seller is great, the manufacturer however, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 22,000 gallon salt water pool. It replaces an old Hayward 1.5 HP single speed pump that had died. 3 months after being installed I couldn't be happier... it is whisper quiet, the pool looks clean and clear, and our power consumption has reduced significantly from the same 3 month period last year. I live in the Cayman Islands, and even with international shipping and duties added, I saved a few hundred dollars buying from Amazon versus a local retailer. With the savings we're seeing on our power bill, this pump will pay for itself inside 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: D. Allott

customer_reviews.title: Received the pump 4 days ago, installed it, ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the pump 4 days ago, installed it, turned on and programmed what I believe will fit my pool's needs. Can't believe the BS from the manufacturer not honoring self installation... Seriously the local pool store was charging $1750 all the while claiming free installation. Told them the price on line and their response was something about the need of professional programming.... Pffff there's nothing difficult about this pump, just a manufacturer unwilling to guarantee its product properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Reliability?
customer_reviews.text: Pump has great features and works well when it does work but the reliability of the controller is extremely poor. Original pump controller went out after 18 months. This is within the 2 year warranty but thats only valid if you have a certified installer put it in, I didn't. I found another controller for $500 (Pentair wants $700) and put it in. That one lasted a year... I just replaced this fancy POS with a Hayward dual speed. It's quiet and effecient but considering the price and additional repair cost definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ford

customer_reviews.title: Good, but Could be Better
customer_reviews.text: I really like the variable speed, built in programmable timer, and built in freeze guard. But it doesn't have any way to close a contact when the pump is running, so that the pool heater and sanitizer can be connected to not turn on when the pump is off. I had to install a second timer, and a flow switch, requiring replumbing the pool equipment. Another two items to check and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: V. D. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pentair does not back their products
customer_reviews.text: Product lasted 16 months then started leaking between the motor and pump, Pentair said they would not warrant the product. Will not buy Pentair products again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This item cut my power bill by over half! I was using a Hayward Super 2 pump with a cartridge filter, and switched to this with a DE filter. For my 17.5k pool with added spa, it has kept it clean and beautiful . For the settings, I run it below 1000 rpm for about 8 hours followed by 2.5k rpm for two hours during the day. Zero problems, manual is easy to understand. Took about 40 minutes for the guy to install new pump and filter.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Has run like a champ for the 2 months since it's been installed!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased and installed roughly two months ago for a commercial pool and has been running consistently since then. The install was very easy, it was traded out for the previous pump in about 10 minutes, by people with a higher than usual level of mechanical knowledge. It functions so well that it can't even be turned up to the highest flow, as it's more than the 4" pipes feeding it can supply. If you turn it up too much, it sucks in air instead of water, so it's set at a suitable level. (Not where I'm typing, unfortunately, so I can't tell you what that is.) I am very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Goth Gone Grey

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: We have attempted to contact seller and no response so I am having to put this in a review to get sellers attention. If seller will help me and resolve the issue I will be happy. Pump was installed and 2 months of running it is leaking. A defect in the way it was built.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: works well. A friend recommended. This product is probably 20 years old but works very well. It's pays for itself over time if you program it. But I sure hope somebody at Pentair is paying attention. Your customers service/product info sucks more than almost ANY company. I called and waited and waited to talk to someone about an electric controller. I wanted to compare them. They were extremely unhelpful. The dealers say "call Pentair" and Pentair says "call your dealer." If other users didn't recommend the product this company would go out of business if left to their own customer support.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Pump Control
customer_reviews.text: The old single speed pump went out so this type of pump is now required where I live. No more single speed pumps allowed. Had it professionally installed and it is so quiet even on the high speed cleaning cycle compared to the old motor. The control panel looks complicated but is not too difficult if you review them on you tube. com. The instruction book is a little difficult to follow but the motor computer gives you an error note if you get it wrong. So far about 9 months its working great.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sauce
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our single-speed pump with this one when we added a roof-mounted solar heat collector and solar controller. The pump shows its current power consumption in Watts and allows you to adjust the RPMs of the pump to fit your gallons-per-minute needs and electricity budget. Our solar pool heating controller "talks" to the pump and tells it what speed to run. On sunny days it goes a bit faster. On cloudy days it slows down to conserve power. I cranked it down to a much lower power consumption level than the old pump that still keeps the pool clean... The solar heating is working well - you can't beat free heat energy!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Be CAREFUL of possible DECAPITATION!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to replace dead motor with this one. New motor starts up with a "prime" cycle, which is high speed and therefore high pressure. Old motor did not have this prime cycle and just started at whatever the speed motor was set at (usually 2). When all was connected, I started the motor with setting 2 and fortunately was not near the filter cap. The cap exploded off the filter with a loud bang and shot up into the overhead tree. I retightened the cap and haven't had a repeat explosion, but I'm careful to stay well away from the filter when starting the motor.
customer_reviews.author: Doodles

customer_reviews.title: Control panel not able to reprogram scheduled run times or speeds
customer_reviews.text: Installed this pump two months ago and already having problems. Control panel not able to reprogram scheduled run times or speeds. I should have listened to feedback and not bought this pump. The manufacturer will not honor their warranty because I self installed the pump. I was smart enough to buy a 3 year warranty from Amazon. Don't buy this pump because there is a good chance that you will regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to 3-hp variable
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a failed 2-hp Hayward Northstar pool pump that gave up after 15 years. New pump installed with very little modification to existing plumbing using the adapter couplings. Installation took about 45 minutes with the old motor and pump already out. Was very easy to program, although the default settings work very well. The programming allows for the pump run times to be scheduled with up to four different running speeds that allows you to save substantial dollars in power expenses. Time will tell if this was a worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Pentair does not honor warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought from Amazon and installed this pump myself a year and a half ago. Now the drive has gone out and the entire pump has to be replaced. Normally this would be covered under Pentair’s 3 year warranty, but because I self-installed it the warranty is voided and Pentair will not honor it for what is obviously a manufacturing defect. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: this was the best deal, shipped and arrived quickly and I installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before deciding on a purchase, this was the best deal, shipped and arrived quickly and I installed it the same day, It took some time to master the programming, you have to do the correct steps all the time or it will not work. Once I lear the programming sequences, it was a piece of cake. It works very, very well. Waiting to see the results on the next electric bill
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful on 3400, very quite on 1200.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pump for over a year now. I keep it running 24/7, with a flow meter, at 1200 rpm and it turns over the whole 2500 Gallon pool in 24 hours while conserving electricity. Programming it can be a little bit challenging, but once it's set up you can just about leave it alone. I use this with a sand filter, so i keep it at lower settings. Its nice and quite at 1200 and become more noticeable around 2000 rpm. its downright loud at 3400 RPM, but that's full blast and it moves a LOT of water at that speed. I only use the high speed when back-flushing the sand filter.
customer_reviews.author: BNP

customer_reviews.title: Drive unit went bad after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Drive unit went bad after 3 years. Unable to program pump. No help from Pentair. Savings were great to begin but very costly if you have to replace it every 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott  King

customer_reviews.title: Pentair Variable Speed to save money.
customer_reviews.text: This should be a welcome change to my pool. The old pump was single speed and my electric bill was high due to running at the only speed (high). Now I use lower speed and watts per hour are much less. I expect my bill to be much lower. I have not received my new bill at this time so I don’t know how much I will save. Rather than try to explain why variable speed pump use less watts, I would suggest you look at the various YouTube videos. I was impressed. So this Pentair variable pump is expected to save me money.
customer_reviews.author: george94509

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the 4th pump in 8 years, let's see how long this new one will last.
customer_reviews.author: LaLuna

customer_reviews.title: Check your state for rebates, A lot of them have them
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only uses 250 watts and I run it all the time only time high speed is needed is when running the Polaris pool cleaner. The Maryland rebate of $400.00 dollars and Pentair rebate of $50.00 dollars make is no more expensive then a single speed pump/ Check your state for rebates.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great VS pump
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this variable speed pump now for 10 months. Everything you read about them is true, my electric bill dropped in half since i've put it in. I run it 8 hours each day, 2 hours on full speed to begin to get surface debris in the skimmers and to assist the pool sweep, 2 hours on a medium speed, then 4 hours on the lowest. I have a 15K gallon inground pool and it works great. I saved about $400 buying it here as opposed to Leslie's. Installed it with a friend and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The pump malfunctioned while under warranty. Waiting for over a month to get a part, in the hot Texas sun, middle of a pandemic and all my five children can do it look at the gross, green pool and wish they could swim. We were willing to pay extra for this pump due to the energy features - what a terrible mistake we made. Pentair says that they are "backed up" trying to fill other orders and can't get to our warranty part even though one person told us that it shipped 10 days ago. So disappointed in this company. Will never purchase Pentair again - simply horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: This is the most awesome pump -- recommended by my pool guy and delivered ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awesome pump -- recommended by my pool guy and delivered on a saturday by Amazon - super impressive customer service from the Amazon folks when the first package got shipped ground by mistake. While this is a little more complicated to operate, it has a self-heating function to protect against freezing and is so so so quiet the neighbors sent a thank you note!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit with flexible settings
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit with flexible settings. For some unknown reason takes most of what this 3 HP pump has to match the flow of the fixed speed 1 1/2 HP it replaces. Requires a setting of 3000 RPM to match the old pump, however at full power 3400 RPM it definitely flows more than the 1 1/2 HP pump. It would be nice if the strainer basket was half again larger. I have not given it 5 stars due to the very convoluted and confusing programming menu.
customer_reviews.author: BDM

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: been using this pump for about 6 months now, I did have it professionally installed so the fact the first one died right away was no big deal ($100 to install was well worth the price) and the replacement has worked flawlessly ever since and has dropped my electric bill $40/ month vs my old pump...would definitely recommend this pump but as a sidebar would also highly recommend spending a bit extra to have it professionally installed as it's just worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Marsden

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken.  Possibly not from the factory.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sent me what appears to be a non factory pump. Very disappointed. The pump leaked after professional installation. The main seal inside the pump was split and my installer said did not appear to be a factory gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Pump part number isn't accurate. I recently installed this unit and also purchased an accessory (Display Relocation Kit, by Pentair) that allows for the digital display to be relocated. After attempting to install the kit, i discovered that the pump i purchased isn't exactly the part number a purchased. Pentair informed me that my pump is an "earlier model". Not sure at this point if the distributor or manufacturer is to blame. Bottom line, i purchased this pump, in part, because of the manufacturer accessories.
customer_reviews.author: stevenc

customer_reviews.title: this Pump is Pretty Smart
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a conventional one speed pump that I'd had for some time as a part of our swimming pool system. My goals were more power when we needed it for vacuuming but power savings the rest of the time. And reliability and convenience. This pump is accomplishing all my goals. Plus things I didn't think much about like self priming and self checking. The one drawback is the programming is not intuitive or maybe even logical and the instructions for programming are vague and incomplete. But once you have it programmed it's done and you should not have to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Los Gatos

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait - pays for itself in no time!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, arrived as expected and does what it says. If you have an older pump, it'll probably pay for itself in no time. Only negative (and the reason for 4 stars) is: upon arrival the gasket was dry/aged and didn't get a good seal, allowing a small air leak and occasional loss of prime even after lubing (it was slightly out of round). After a few bucks for a new gasket it worked great & as expected.
customer_reviews.author: ArthurD123

customer_reviews.title: Roll the dice!  Maybe your luck is better than mine, but maybe it isn't.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind that you'll have no support from Amazon or Pentair after 60 days if you buy this here, go for it. Roll the dice. Maybe you can end up with a non-functioning motor after 2.5 years like me paying another $450 to replace the motor, plus installation costs. FYI, my pump was professionally installed and maintained along with a brand new filter. No reason it shouldn't have lasted 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Weed

customer_reviews.title: NOT built to last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump in 2015 and it lasted 4 1/2 years. I agree that it's more energy-efficient than the pump it replaced and quieter as well. Now, sadly, the display is failing. I called Pentair and they advised that: 1) my pump is no longer covered by the extended (3 year) warranty and 2) the display board cannot be replaced. I must order a new drive. I would have recommended this product until now, but not any longer. Shop elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to install the pump without changing any of the piping for my old single speed pump. I like the 4 default settings for slow filtering, for faster filtering and the 2 highest speeds for backwash or vacuuming. It is also very quiet. It has only been running about a month, so I can't say anything about reliability yet or about whether the promised electricity savings are real.
customer_reviews.author: Don W Hartman

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and now it's dead.
customer_reviews.text: The paint on the motor started to flake off a year after it was installed. It's on a dedicated circuit with a good earth ground. The bearing started to whine around the two year mark, and today the electronics failed. Just order a Hayward pump to replace it and will stay away from all Pentair products after this!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Cernogorsky

customer_reviews.title: Good pump when working
customer_reviews.text: I had the Pentair 011018 IntelliFlo Variable Speed High Performance Pool Pump installed on my new pool. The control panel failed after 2 years and was out of warranty. Next the pump failed after 3 years and 1 month and was out of warranty. Not much more to say here. This was my experience
customer_reviews.author: Frank F.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive parts (Keypad) to replace
customer_reviews.text: Exactly after 3 years, the LCD is out, moisture is showing inside the LCD. Pump is working, however. 3 stars due to expensive replacement of part and Pump itself is expensive. It would be great if Keypad housing can be made water proof to avoid costly repairs.
customer_reviews.author: sanjay gupta

customer_reviews.title: Powwerful and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet pump. Sometimes I have to listen closely to see if it's on. My only complaints are that the instructions for programming it is a little difficult, the lid is kind of a pain to put back on and the basket is a little small, but it seems to be a powerful pump and setting the RPMs to about 3000 generates enough pressure to push the water up and through my solar panels which are located on my second-story roof.
customer_reviews.author: Suprsu

customer_reviews.title: the bearings started making noise after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: the pump is good and worked well for 3 months. After three months the pump started squealing at speeds above 1900 rpm after 3 months. Called the factory and they said it was probably a bearing. They would do nothing for me. I did get asurion insurance and we will see what happens. I would not buy with out getting insurance. I am unimpressed with the manufacture standing by there warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M.

customer_reviews.title: So far this pump works great. It is extremely quiet and we have been ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this pump works great. It is extremely quiet and we have been told by the installer that we are guaranteed to cut our electrical bill. (I will follow up with that once we run it for a few months) We did have it installed by a professional pool company in order to take advantage of the warranty. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that is came damaged in shipping. It had nothing to do with the pump but with the packaging and shipping. It was a small damage that the pool installer said would not affect the way the pump worked so we did not bother to request a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Using for geothermal circulation pump...excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The pump doesn't need a controller. My relay from the thermostat turns it on and off. There is a setting in the control box to shut off all other controls and simply use a normal relay. Finding a specific size geothermal pump is troublesome but this pump can be set to any level to allow the proper gpm flow rate needed for virtually any installation. I installed it in Feb 2019 and now it's March 2020. It still works great and is saving me a ton on energy costs over my 1993 standard pump/motor.
customer_reviews.author: pjg

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, quiet
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, quiet, powerful. Adjusted max flow down to 2800 rpm & set it on a schedule. Works as advertised. This replaced a Hayward 2 hp that worked fine, just wanted the power savings of variable speed. Enjoying the reduced noise levels as well.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and a big money saver.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the pump myself with no issues. Easy to program the timer. My pool is cleaner with this pump running at a slower speed than it was with the old run running at 100%. My electric bills are nearly $100 less during Swimming pool season. Counting the rebate from my electricity supplier, this pump nearly paid for itself in the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Topher B

customer_reviews.title: Warrenty is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump 23 months ago and was just told buy my pool service it has failed and needs to be replaced. I mentioned its not that old and are they sure its the pump, sadly they said this pump was a least 5 yrs old and was failed. I am highly disappointed and will never purchase another pump from Pentair again. No warranty since I purchased on line and no I did not purchase the extended warranty. I am now out an addtl $1400.00 DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Schoepflin

customer_reviews.title: Best pump I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best pump I ever owned! An immediate drop in electric bill. Plus, with the variable settings and quality from Pentair, I anticipate this pump will last the 10 yr+ its been rated at. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: joe k

customer_reviews.title: No longevity
customer_reviews.text: Never buy an Intelliflo because the variable drive (brain) will go out after the 12 month warranty and it costs $650 to replace it. There is no way to repair the drive so you are screwed. The drive goes out for a variety of reasons, many of which you have no control over like lightning strikes in the area (even when they don't hit you they can still short out the drive). The pump motor is 3 phase so you cannot run it separately either.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have mine also running my solar heating panels and it works great. Its very quiet, easy to install and the variable speeds are great. The digital panel makes it very easy to control once you get it programmed. Definitely need the owners manual for programming.
customer_reviews.author: gustave N

customer_reviews.title: How can a pump costing this much fail after 4 years...
customer_reviews.text: It appears the bearings are going on this "high end" pump after just 4 years. Called Pentair... we warrant for two years. OK. How long do these typically last... can't say. All under different operating conditions. Really... please, they know they last at least two years since that is what they warrant for... very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: kirk p.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. Works with Jandy Aqualink RS, and it will control the speed as well, not just the on/off function. This replaced our Pentair Whisperflo single speed. Loving the energy savings. Cut our usage almost in half and we are running the pool filter 3 hours more a day.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Bayview

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love the variable speed, my pool pump is not in an ideal location. Helps to have it on at a lower speed so its not so loud. Cut my electric bill by about $30 a month, paying for itself in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Dead in almost exactly four years to the date.
customer_reviews.text: If this was a cheap pump, I may be okay with four years of service, but a pump this expensive that runs a low RPM should last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sieber

customer_reviews.title: Lemon + Expensive parts + crappy warranty = DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Since Warranty expired 3 months ago, we spent $300 replacing a "melted" impeller (so much for the overheating sensor, right?) And now, the electronic driver and lcd fried! $650 to replace. Taking into account you can get a Hayward Superpump for $400 we are considering this option. Plus, Pentair's customer service is very poor and to top it off they don't deal with "residential owners".
customer_reviews.author: Claudio Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good value, cheesy warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Crapy warranty. Only months unless installed by pool guy. By the Amazon warranty 3 years for $33. Would give 5 stars except for warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Don't buy local

customer_reviews.title: Great money saving pool pump.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had a professional install it and in two weeks I've already seen my electric bill go down. And the pool is cleaning better than my dying traditional one was. I'm happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: crazeemarchese

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace our old pool pump and was looking for a high efficiency model. This pump is so quiet you cant tell it's on. I waited to review it to see what my savings would be on electric. 3 months running it has gone done @ $50. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for a couple of weeks now. Very ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using for a couple of weeks now. Very quite in slow mode. Have pop-ups that run 4 hours on high speed and then low speed for 6 hours. Should see big decrease in electric bill as I was running at full speed for 10 hours. Pool is staying clean even thru Arizona dust storms.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg L.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. It cut my electric bill by ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. It cut my electric bill by about 450 a year. It should pay for itself in a little over 2 years. Wish I had purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Diesel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet,powerful pump
customer_reviews.text: The pump came in damaged. Sent it back and got a new one in a couple of days. The pump was extremely easy to install. I had to rework a little of the plumbing due to the height difference in this model and my last pentair. The pump is very quiet on any speed other than wide open. About the same as most pumps at height speed. Programming was easy ,although time consuming. To early to tell but it appears it will save quite a lot in power consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old single speed pump with this Pentair variable speed. It’s super quiet, excellent and easy to use programming features, remote connection. Best of all, low power consumption (even at full speed) saves us a ton of money on our electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: This pool pump delivers just like it says. I just installed it a few days ago and it is so quite compared to a single speed pump. Will have to see if it really cuts back on electricity like it says but I am so glad I spent the extra on this pump because I can already see it will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a 15 month old Hayward
customer_reviews.text: My second unit. Replacing a Hayward variable speed that only lasted 15 months. The control board on the Hayward failed and cost as much as a new pump to replace Stay with the Pentair.
customer_reviews.author: BILLIE P. NEAL

customer_reviews.title: The pump itself is great but it did not come with installation manual or ...
customer_reviews.text: The pump itself is great but it did not come with installation manual or even screws for the power cover. I had to go to a local pool store and pay for 4 small screws to attached the small loose shipped cover.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Running for several months now with great results. Quiet and cost effective. I did buy an in-line flow meter so that I could determine the proper speed to set the pump at
customer_reviews.author: Acampoman

customer_reviews.title: Great pumps
customer_reviews.text: These are great pumps,unfortunately had to send back as the bearing was bad in it. Needed a replacement right away so had to have our pool service get us one which we paid more for. But the pumps work outstanding. Hard to program,but once done it is saving us over 100.00 a month on our electric bill. Play around with settings to use slowest speeds that will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela H.

customer_reviews.title: Great investment, super quiet, and money saver
customer_reviews.text: So far, it’s amazing. So quiet, easy to install, and easy to setup. I Youtubed how to program it and it made it super simple. I haven’t received my first bill but I can tell I’ll be saving a decent amount.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Best pump on market!!
customer_reviews.text: Best price anywhere. I saved about $500-$550 buying it on amazon to include install. Had to have it professionally installed for warranty purposes. This thing is quiet at low speeds. And saving me allot on electric. Pics show what my wattage is at the RPMs I have set in it. You can't beat this pump!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Love the Pump - but less than thrilled about the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the Pump - but less than thrilled about the quality control for packaging. The bag of associated hardware was missing the screws to attach the power supply box so had to just silicone it to the pump housing, and the included Installation and User's Guide was for the Whisperflo not the Intelliflo. Fortunately I found the correct guide on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It fit the bill.
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Installation was easy, piping lined up with previous lines from Hayward Northstar pump (which lasted 10+ years). - Programming and product manual were easy too. - Set your own speed is great for setting proper flow rates. - Very quiet. - Packaged arrived undamaged. Cons - Questioning cost versus two speed pump, but didn't have time to do all the math.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: The day I installed this pump it started saving money! With the variable speed capability, I can run the pump longer for better filtration and use nowhere near the electricity that I did with my old pump. Having read other reviews where the reviewer complained about the "cheap" plastic timer cover, I haven't found a problem at all. It's not supposed to be a steel trap door!
customer_reviews.author: John Klunder

customer_reviews.title: however once done seems to power everything nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving it. It is quiet and saving us energy. It is a bit bigger than the old pump so had to make some plumbing changes, however once done seems to power everything nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N.

customer_reviews.title: My last Pentair 1 1/2 HP single speed gave out ...
customer_reviews.text: My last Pentair 1 1/2 HP single speed gave out a month ago after 10 years of service. So I had my pool guy put in Pentair IntelliFlo Variable Speed pump 2 weeks ago. I had it on 750rpm on 6 hours day. The pump is quiet and clean the pool well. A very well built pump.
customer_reviews.author: Ming L. Wu

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PUMP !!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT purchase this pump until Pentair fixes the issue it has with the GFI beaker tripping after the grid power has gone off and then comes back on. There are many cases of this problem and Pentair refuses to acknowledge the problem. Yes it is a very good pump and does save about 80% energy but until Pentair fixes the GFI tripping glitch I would NOT recommend purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love thin pump.
customer_reviews.text: Live this pump. Already see the difference on electric bill. If pump sits out in the sun get a cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I WISH THAT I HAD THIS POOL PUMP, FOUR POOL PUMPS AGO!! RUNS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN JACKSON SR

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM -
customer_reviews.text: I was warned about this pump, but chose to give it a try. I had it professionally installed and it worked great for exactly 7 months, then the motor burnt up and now does not work and I need to get a new one. If you are considering buying this, please read all reviews. Seems many others have had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Harrington

customer_reviews.title: We are so happy with this pump!
customer_reviews.text: It is quiet, to the extent that sometimes you have to look to see if the water is moving - fantastic after the old pump which drowned out a lot of other noises. We are waiting for the utility bill to see how much it has dropped, compared to the old pump. It's amazing how clean the water is, and how quiet this is.
customer_reviews.author: Jill D

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later and it's broken
customer_reviews.text: Spent and arm and a leg, had it professionally installed and now it's broken. Be wary of getting this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Devyn Reggio

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet pool pump and very energy efficient
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet pool pump and very energy efficient. Recently has our pool resurfaced and need a better pump, even when this pump is on it's highest speed it is still a million times more quite than our old Hayward super pump. Good Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: GNEWT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great item saving money on variable speed, also received city rebate. great item
customer_reviews.author: Robert L

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to install if you know how to measure and use a saw. The pump is quiet at medium speeds but screams at high speeds but is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: 1 warranty issue at power-on. Pentair helped. Will update review with performance of pump.
customer_reviews.text: Had 1 warranty issue (shipping box looked fine but was possibly caused by shipping) out of box. Pentair shipped a replacement cover and fan. Made a video of what happened when I turned it on. [...]
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: I like this pump.  Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Flawless operation, easy install, quiet and powerful. A little difficult to program. User interface is not as straightforward as it could be but manageable. Spend time learning to operate it and getting to know it. Will re-visit and update review in regards to cost effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pump. It solved a couple of problems for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pump. It solved a couple of problems for me. 1) Moves a lot of water and provided better circulation than my Challenger pump. 2) It is saving money. I'm thinking it will pay for itself inside a year and that is before I fine tune the speed by looking at wattage and water volume being pumped. I'm thinking I can save another 10% a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I found the warranty is no good because I installed it
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for the same model pump (purchased by different home owner). After installing the pump myself, I found the warranty is no good because I installed it. Don't buy this unless you plan on paying a "Qualified" installer to install it. Also,who knows what a "Qualified" installer means.Only Pentair Knows...... I'm returning my pump. Amazon should stop offering this unit.
customer_reviews.author: JimB

customer_reviews.title: Super nice pump. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a Hayward pool pump. This pump is so much nicer and way more energy efficient. I run it at 1200 rpm 24/7. At this speed it consumes about 200 watts and does a fantastic job keeping my pool clean and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Regira

customer_reviews.title: Pentair 011018 IntelliFlow Variable Speed Pump is great performing product for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Pentair 011018 IntelliFlow Variable Speed Pump has made a great impact on the overall cleaning functions of our pool. We are in the process of seeing our 1st full month of seeing our electric bill but the first 2 weeks have already shown a $100 + savings as compared to our previous bill under similar weather and operating conditions. We had some minor shipping damage but we quickly had the electrical access Dorris and gasket replaced under warranty by the local Pentair distributor to save time. We also had a pool contractor install the pump for warranty guarantees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient and quiet pool pump
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient and quiet pool pump. I actually have to go over to it to see if it is running it is so quiet. Only had it a few weeks so waiting to see the cost savings on utility bill.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Pentair UI (User Interface) designer should be fired.
customer_reviews.text: The pump is awesome, though Pentair would be better off if they fired an idiot who came up with an idea of having two enter keys: "Select" and "Enter". Naturally, you want to press "Enter" key when you want to enter to a menu, InteliFlo interface will display error message if you will do that. You have to click "Select" button with cross on. Yes, "Select" button with cross on it meant enter, "Enter" button means something else... hysterically idiotic UI design. What does Pentair UI designer smoke?
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: One thing that would have been nice is if there was a way to control when my booster pump runs based on the programing on this main pump....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Pentair 011018 IntelliFlo Variable Speed High Performance Pool Pump, 3 Horsepower, 230 Volt, 1 Phase - Energy Star Certified
product_meta.description: Color:011018Traditional pumps operate at set, unchangeable speeds. Those speeds are almost always higher than required. As a result, they overpower the jobs they're assigned to do, which wastes energy. Intelliflo allows custom programming of optimum pump speeds for specific tasks such as filtering, heating, cleaning, spa jets and waterfalls. for virtually all applications, the optimum speed is lower than the preset, unchangeable speeds of older pumps. When water moves more slowly for longer periods, it helps reduce the occurrence of algae that forms more easily when water is pumped briskly and then allowed to rest for long intervals. Your filter works more effectively because it has more time to sift out particles from the water, and because particles aren't forced through the Filter media under needlessly high pressure. Automatic chemical dispensers and chlorinators also work better when water is kept moving.
feature_bullets: Energy savings up to 90-percent vs. traditional pumps
Dramatically quieter operation; Carton Wt: 45 pounds
8 programmable speed settings and built-in timer assure optimum speed and run times for maximum efficiency and savings
Built in diagnostics protect the pump for longer service life
Fully compatible with IntelliTouch, EasyTouch, SunTouch Pool Control Systems and other brands of digital pool/spa controls for managing pump, heating, lighting, spa jets and water features

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars506 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
